thread.title: This Wolfsburg goal was one of the crispiest volleys you'll see today
thread.title_full: This Wolfsburg goal was one of the crispiest volleys you'll see today

title: This Wolfsburg goal was one of the crispiest volleys you'll see today
text:
Feb 12, 2017 at 12:44p ET 0Shares 
VfL Wolfsburg beat TSG Hoffenheim 2-1 on Sunday to secure a vital three points in the battle to avoid relegation. Maximilian Arnoldâ€™s equalizing goal in the 50th minute set the stage for their comeback, and it also marked the 600th home goal scored in the clubâ€™s history. This one is so good it should count for two. ðŸ˜±ðŸ˜± #WOBTSG #Bundesliga https://t.co/UyIQuXeqC5 
â€” FOX Soccer (@FOXSoccer) February 12, 2017 
Thereâ€™s absolutely nothing the keeper can do about that. Arnold times the bounce, catches it cleanly, and launches a perfect volley into the lower corner to bring Wolfsburg level and bring his team level on the day. 
Arnold strikes it so well, itâ€™s still rising as it crashes in to the back of the net. Itâ€™s the type of volley that probably still would have gone in if he struck it from 10 yards further away. You really just donâ€™t stop strikes like that. 
Technique, power, three points, and a little bit of history to go along with it? Not a bad day at the office.
